explanation: Funds are required to: procure: VC-25A modifications for the Block Upgrade. program, which

Funds are available to procure VC-25A modifications for the Block Upgrade program because they are excess to need for the E-3 Airborne Warning and Control System (AWACS). There are no other known program requirements for the funding at this time and no major impacts to the program.

Funds are required to procure 24 Stinger Vehicle Universal Launchers (SVULs) which are required for production and delivery of Maneuver Short Range Air Defense (M-SHORAD) Inc 1 systems. This request is not related to the Armyâ€™s support to Ukraine. This requirement was previously approved via the FY 22-11 PA reprogramming action, however, the Army was unable to fund due to a lack of approved sources. The Army was able to break the requirement into smaller procurements.

Funds are available due to the initial B-Kit procurement for APR-39E(V)2 countermeasure equipment originally scheduled for FY 2022 that moved to FY 2023. This is due to a need for additional Joint Preflight Integration of Munitions and Electronic Systems (JPRIMES) testing and a shift in contract strategy. The production decision has been delayed until system qualification and performance testing can be completed to show stability in design.
